page.title: 03Warsop Parish Centre
page.content: In the N.W.of the block is a group of buildings used today as a community centre.The principal part of the complex is a Tudor barn,though much of the rest dates back to the 13th. century,forming part of the Medieval manor house where the Lord of the Manor of Warsop would have lived. In the 16th.century the manor was improved and today it still has beautiful Tudor mullioned windows,said to be the finest in the country! Many years later the building,then called Old Hall Farm,belonged to the FitzHerbert family.This family sold the Hall to the Urban District Council and,with the help of the Notts. Building Preservation Trust and contributions from local people,the Old Hall was converted into a community centre in 1974.It is the venue for many local activities.
